conbody.p: What is Elasticsearch? "Elasitcsearch is a search engine based on the Lucene library. It provides a distributed, multitenant-capable full-text search engine with an HTTP web interface and schema-free JSON documents. Elasticsearch is developed by Java." -Wikipedia
HOWEVER, Elasticsearch also produces logging and monitoring tools. Which do we use? I suspect Nokia uses the logging and monitoring tools rather than the search tools, but perhaps I am wrong.
It wasn't mentioned in the VNF docs, so it must be useful for CNF only.
ELK stack is used to "take data from any source, in any form, then search, analyze, and visualize it in real time".

In an ELK stack, "...Elasticsearch is a real-time, distributed storage, search, and analytics engine. It can be used for many purposes, bu one context where it excels is indexing streams of semi-structured data, such as logs or decoded network packets." So basically Elasticsearch is fed logs, which are in turn made searchable and given to some other process.
